thread.title: "The Martian" skyrockets to top of box office
thread.title_full: "The Martian" skyrockets to top of box office

title: "The Martian" skyrockets to top of box office
text:
"The Martian" skyrockets to top of box office Sunday, October 04, 2015 - 01:17 
Critics praise director Ridley Scott for ''The Martian'' which lifts-off at the box office with $55 million, and ''Hotel Transylvania 2'' holds steady at second place. Jillian Kitchener reports. ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript 
"The Martian" went to great heights at the box office this weekend with a massive $55 million in North American ticket sales. Critics say it's director Ridley Scott's best work. And Matt Damon is praised for his performance as an astronaut stranded on the Red Planet. His character, Mark Watney, puts his left-brained survival skills to work while NASA tries to beat the clock. Last weekend's champ "Hotel Transylvania 2" sunk its teeth into second place with $33 million. This animated sequel has earned $90.5 million after two weeks and is projected to cross the $100 million mark by next weekend. Driving into third place with $12.1 million, the drug war thriller "Sicario". Agents, like Emily Blunt's character, travel back-and-forth across the U.S.-Mexican border searching for a big cartel boss. ...With some surprises along the way.
